question: What is the purpose of ComfyUI-Static-Primitives?
answer: ComfyUI-Static-Primitives adds Static Primitives to ComfyUI, mainly to work with reroute nodes and help simplify avoiding wire spaghetti in the user interface.

question: How can you install ComfyUI-Static-Primitives?
answer: To install ComfyUI-Static-Primitives, you need to clone the repo inside your custom_nodes folder using the command: `git clone https://github.com/80sVectorz/ComfyUI-Static-Primitives.git`

question: What new node category is added by ComfyUI-Static-Primitives?
answer: ComfyUI-Static-Primitives adds a new node category called 'primitives'.

question: Which basic data-types are covered by the primitives in ComfyUI-Static-Primitives?
answer: ComfyUI-Static-Primitives includes a primitive for all the basic data-types.

question: What is the collection type system in ComfyUI-Static-Primitives?
answer: The collection type system in ComfyUI-Static-Primitives allows users to add custom collection types. By default, it includes samplers and schedulers.

question: How can users add their own collection primitives in ComfyUI-Static-Primitives?
answer: Users can find information on how to add their own collection primitives in ComfyUI-Static-Primitives by referring to the file located at https://github.com/80sVectorz/ComfyUI-Static-Primitives/blob/main/collection_primitives/collection_primitives_readme.md.

question: Why were static primitives created for ComfyUI-Static-Primitives?
answer: Static primitives were created for ComfyUI-Static-Primitives because reroutes don't work with dynamic primitives. Static primitives have a predefined type and can work with reroutes, helping to simplify the user interface and avoid wire spaghetti.
